arm_group.description: Patients requiring renal replacement therapy from 2011 to 2012 on intensive care unit
Patients requiring renal replacement on intensive care unit in 2013 and 2014

brief_summary.textblock:
Acute renal failure is a common complication in intensive care unit patients. In 10% of
      cases renal replacement therapy becomes necessary. Current devices have  increase filter
      patency and efficacy. However, magnesium, calcium and phosphate are eliminated as well.
      However, the extend of this elimination hase not been quantified. Thus, we want to

        1. record retrospectively how often abnormal values for phosphate, magnesium and calcium
           occurred during routine renal replacement therapy in 2011 and 2012.

        2. prospectively  evaluate the same parameters during routine treatment in 2013 and 2014

clinical_study.brief_title: Mineral-Homeostasis in Continuous Renal Replacement Therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  intensive care unit patients with acute renal failure undergoing continuous renal
             replacement therapy

          -  older than 18 years of age

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  age less than 18 years

          -  pregnancy

          -  contraindications against continuous renal replacement therapy

study_pop.textblock: intensive care unit patients with acute renal failure undergoing renal replacement therapy

clinical_study.official_title: Phosphate, Magnesium and Calcium-Homeostasis in Patients With Acute Renal Failure and Continuous Renal Replacement Therapy

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Anaesthesiology, Duesseldorf University Hospital

primary_outcome.description: Participants will be followed for the duration of ICU stay, an expected average of 28 days

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
